field.name: summary
field.value: assembly resource format only works for resources where the assemblies name and default namespace are the same.

field.name: description
field.value:
At current the assembly resources are specified like so:
assembly://companyname.productname.core/myfile.xml
Which works fine, if:
The assembly is compiled via VS.NET or in Nant with additional switches. The assembly name and the default namespace are aligned.
The proposed change is to support a path to the resource that is non-relative, ie.
assembly://companyname.productname.core/companyname/productname/core/myfile. config
where the first part establishes the assembly name, and the rest of the path is used to build the resource name ie. the forward slashes are replaced with periods (.) to produce a resource name of "companyname.productname.core.myfile.config".
This addition is a breaking change, if possible it should try and be backwards compatible - perhaps trying to locate the resource using a fully qualified path, and failing that a relative one based on the name of the assembly.
